title: @Riot A question about our favorite cosmic vagabond.
body:
Bard was originally meant to be a music based champion; his theme shifted quite a bit between his early phases and his official announcement. This makes me wonder about what we could have ended up with.

What were some of the abilities that Bard had in development that got scrapped?

replies.body:
Bard went through a lot of different abilities before we hit on his final kit, including at one point getting briefly iceboxed until we took another run at his gameplay. Some abilities off the top of the head with musical/sounds elements to them we tried:

* A three charge single target skillshot that applied a stun on the final shot if you fired all 3 shots to a beat that was playing. Was a lot of fun to mess around with against bots/minions, but felt really restrictive in actual PVP unfortunately,
* A DDR/Guitar hero style ult, matching visual effects to a beat. Same problem as above - sounded cool, but didn't actually work out well in game. I do wonder if there might be a more subtle version of this sort of ability that might work though.
* A passive that dropped a lay waste style effect under targets Bard hit with an auto attack, with the effect detonating after a certain number of beats. This one showed promise, wouldn't surprise me if some variant on it eventually ends up on a kit.
* A giant wave of slow moving sound that gradually moved across the map, silencing enemies while they remained within it (had a thickness of around 1200 units, moved at something like 600 units. Looked awesome, but felt really random given how far in advance you had to cast it, which isn't good gameplay for a silence which is a pretty reactive effect. Slow moving wave from one side of the map to the other's still got some promise though, can imagine us revisiting that as well someday with a different effect on it on a different champ.

Oh, cool, Meddler's answering Bard questions! Well, a Bard question. On the off chance that he'll field multiple...

* How happy are you with how Bard is thought of?
* From what I've seen, there's a huge skillcap for Bard play, and he's not that newcomer-friendly. He's received small buff after small buff for a while now. How much of a concern is it that in making him more accessible to less experienced Barders, he'll become too strong in the hands of experts?
* Though it's certainly a plenty weird one, Bard's kit is that of a generalist support. What is it about Bard's design that lets him feel much more impactful than other generalist supports like Sona?

Really great job making this champion. I've had so much fun playing Bard; he's such a flexible and powerful champion. The aesthetic is stellar too. Thanks!

I'm personally really happy with Bard overall, the overall personality his kit/appearance/sounds conveys especially. I do worry somewhat about how his kit can be misleading for newer players to him though in terms of when to collect chimes, when and who to ult, when to E (and when to definitely not E). That does mean that as you describe there's some risk of him ending up too strong at the top end. Given he's performing weaker post preseason changes than before however I think we should be ok in that regard with the small buff in 6.1 which is much more an occasional useability thing than a significant power boost.

In terms of feeling impactful Bard's power comes in really discreet, obvious ways mainly (XP from chimes being the biggest exception). His high moments, the ult and E especially, are also extremely high, so even if he's not necessarily contributing that much overall when he does get something right it can feel like he's deciding teamfights.

Speaking about misleading kits and how personality is conveyed, how well do you think Bard performs in his role as League's resident Wandering Caretaker in-game?

While he's easily one of my favorite champions, I was never particularly successful with him--I always thought it was because I was getting chimes at the wrong time or not roaming to mid enough to drop a shrine or two for them, but as it turns out, success with Bard requires a...surprising amount of aggression, to say the least (and not really all that much wandering). Stuff like throwing an attack the enemy's way every now and then is actually fine as far as character goes--aside from limiting aggression, is also succeeds in conveying Bard as a generally peaceful dude, since in the context of that passive alone, he's only a threat when his Meeps are around to intervene.

Everything else about Bard, however, makes him seem more like a Wandering Playmaker than anything. All of the successful plays I've seen with him (particularly in the pro scene) involve huge ganks with Magical Journey, set-ups for double kills with aggressive use of his Q, and his shrines are almost exclusively used as a way to help an ally get in a position to finish a kill. Looking at every guide, it's always max Q first, build some offensive AP items, max W last, look for ganks, etc. (even Rioters on the board suggest offensive burst damage Masteries rather than anything that could be used to aid allies); so while I looked at his kit at launch and thought "ah, I should max W and E so I can roam around the map and make sure everyone is having a good time," that was ultimately the cause of me "using him wrong."

I kind of wish his kit [was more about what it says on Bard's tin](http://lolredesigns.blogspot.com/2013/11/champion-redesign-bard-wandering.html), although I'll still play him the way I want regardless and have fun with him win or lose. When I'm Bard, no amount of kills or assists can top the warmth and gratitude I get when I trek all the way into mid or our jungle and help one of my allies get back on their feet.

I guess that would be a bit restrictive and probably have the same problems as you mentioned for rhythm based abilities though. Anyway, I really enjoy Bard the way he is (though he could benefit from some love specific to the howling abyss), keep the good work :).

Completely off topic, but talking mixing music into MOBA gameplay compels me to ask.   

Have you played Crypt of the Necrodancer? It was a pretty cool marriage of two unlikely genres, rhythm based game + roguelike.

I have! Really enjoyed it, to my slight surprise (I'm only a moderate fan of rhythm games and love some rogue likes/have no patience for others). 

Also had the music stuck in my head for days after playing it a bunch, was a really solid soundtrack.
Any chance of Bard having the QOL change in the future of having his Q indicator indicate both pre and post first target hits.  The guesstimation on that is sometimes frustrating.

So Bard had an ability like Nami ult but with a Silence? Yeesh.

While you are here meddler i was wondering why some abilities like bard ult will take a lot of time  to hit if you fire it far away but some like nami bubble will always take the same time. If you guys would ever want to make bard a bit more consistent to play i think his ult should always have the same delay (sometimes im really shocked by how long it takes to land it if i throw it far).

It would be pretty unbalanceable if it worked that way. Bard getting to stun people for 2.5 seconds from half the map away is really, really strong. It's balanced by the fact that a max-range R takes a long time to land, and the target can easily evade it. Any fixed delay would have to be long enough that Bard can't decide mid lane without having to really leave bot lane. The downside of that is that his very short range ults would then have to have the same long delay, making it way less useful for his own lane, and eliminating all the cool plays made possible by the fairly quick travel time on short range ults.

This would have broader implications as well. Since Bard would no longer gain much selfish power at level 6 as he does on live, he'd end up with a very strange power curve, with his midgame dip getting even worse, and being entirely reliant on having a good mid laner to be functional. To make the change roughly power neutral, you'd have to buff some other part of his kit, and who knows what effects that would have.
